meanings.english_definition: in an inadequate manner; insufficiently; inappropriately.

examples.sentence: Il lavoro è stato svolto inadeguatamente.
examples.translation: The work was done inadequately. (その仕事は不適切に行われた。)
He was treated inadequately. (彼は不十分に扱われた。)

examples.sentence: Il problema è stato affrontato inadeguatamente.
examples.translation: The problem was addressed inadequately. (その問題は不適切に対処された。)

collocations: affrontare inadeguatamente (不適切に対処する)
curare inadeguatamente (不適切に治療する)
svolgere inadeguatamente (不適切に実行する)

etymology.value: Derived from the Italian word 'inadeguato' (inadequate) with the suffix '-mente' (which forms adverbs).

usage_notes.explanation: The adverb 'inadequadamente' describes how something is done in an insufficient or inappropriate way. It implies a lack of quality or suitability in the manner of execution. It is used to express that something was not done well enough or in the right way.

examples.note: Remember to use the adverbial form '-mente' when modifying a verb or adjective.

readability_explanation.text: The word 'inadequadamente' is an adverb used to describe something done in an insufficient or inappropriate manner. It is formed by adding '-mente' to the adjective 'inadeguato' (inadequate). It is used to express that something was not done well enough or in the right way. It is a relatively formal word and is more common in written Italian than in spoken Italian.

example_sentences.sentence: La risposta è stata data inadeguatamente.
Il problema è stato gestito inadeguatamente.
